post.description:
This endpoint returns tracking information for multiplee piece shipments, Group MPS, or an outbounddd shipment which is linked to a return shipment.
Note: FedEx APIs do not support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) mechanism.

errors.message: Please provide a valid reference/associated type
Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.
We could not authorize your credentials. Please check your permissions and try again.
The resource you requested is no longer available. Please modify your request and try again.
We encountered an unexpected error and are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.
The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

parameters.name: x-customer-transaction-id
parameters.description: This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: This is used to indicate the media type of the resource. The media type is a string sent along with the file indicating format of the file.

parameters.name: x-locale
parameters.description: This indicates the combination of language code and country code. Click here to see Locales

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: This indicates the authorization token for the input request.

x-code-samples.source:
<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/track/v1/associatedshipments');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders(array(
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer ',
  'X-locale' => 'en_US',
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
));

$request->setBody(input); // 'input' refers to JSON Payload

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

import requests

url = "https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/track/v1/associatedshipments"

payload = input # 'input' refers to JSON Payload
headers = {
    'Content-Type': "application/json",
    'X-locale': "en_US",
    'Authorization': "Bearer "
    }

response = requests.post(url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

includeDetailedScans.description:
Indicates if detailed scans are requested or not.
Valid values are True, or False.

associatedType.description:
The associated shipment type, such as MPS, Group MPS, or an outbound shipment which is linked to a return shipment.
Example: STANDARD_MPS
STANDARD_MPS: Single shipment with multiple packages, where tracking number got assigned to all pieces, one tracking number is treated as master tracking number while others are child tracking numbers.
Group MPS: Behavior is just like standard MPS but it’s created differently. The shipper must be enrolled for this by a particular reference type like ‘PO’ (purchase order).Then any package order create on the same day going to the same place that has the reference number will get grouped into GMPS relationships.
OUTBOUND_LINK_TO_RETURN: is an RTRN relationship.Same concept as an MPS.the OUTBOUND_LINK_TO_RETURN is the Master outbound package tracking number, that when tracked with this indicator you can get all the child return pieces.

Full_Schema_Multiple_Piece_Shipment.description: The request elements for Tracking by associated shipment.

shipDateBegin.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number within a specific date range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: 2020-03-29

shipDateEnd.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number within a specific date range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: 2020-04-01

TrackingInfo.description: Tracking details for the shipment to be tracked

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

TrkcResponseVO_Associated.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

completeTrackResults.description: Contains the detailed tracking entry information.

alerts.description:
The cxs alert type, alert code, and alert messages.
Example: example: TRACKING.DATA.NOTFOUND - Tracking data unavailable

TrackingMPSResponse.description: The response elements for Tracking by Associated Shipment request.

trackingNumber.description:
A tracking number to identify a package.
Example: 123456789012

trackResults.description: An array of detailed tracking information for the requested packages(s). In case of duplicate shipments, multiple track details will be populated.

meterNumber.description:
The associated meter number for your FedEx account number. Maximum of 9 characters.
Example: 8468376

destinationLocation.description: Location details for the recipient where the package will be or has been delivered.

informationNotes.description: Notifications to the end user that provide additional information relevant to the tracked shipment. For example, a notification may indicate that a change in behavior has occurred.

specialHandlings.description:
Indicate the special handlings on the package being tracked. Includes Special handlings requested for the package like signature options, Broker select or COD etc.
Click here to see FedEx Express Special Handling Codes.

availableImages.description: The available tracking documents for the shipment being tracked. Available tracking documents includes SPOD and Bill of lading.

scanEvents.description: FedEx scan event information for a shipment. Includes the list of events and/or scans applied.

dateAndTimes.description: Date and time information for the tracked shipment. Date and time information for the tracked shipment includes various type of date time including when the package was shipped, when it is expected to deliver, when it is actually delivered etc.

goodsClassificationCode.description:
Classification codes for the goods in package. Goods classification codes required for clearance purpose.
Example: goodsClassificationCode

holdAtLocation.description: Location details for the FedEx facility holding package for delivery. Populated only when REDIRECT_TO_HOLD_AT_LOCATION is available as custom delivery options.

customDeliveryOptions.description: List of delivery options that can be used to customize the delivery of the package.

estimatedDeliveryTimeWindow.description: The estimated window for time of delivery.  May be periodically updated based on available in-flight shipment information.

pieceCounts.description: Piece count information at origin and destination.

recipientInformation.description: Contact and address information of recipient.

standardTransitTimeWindow.description: The standard committed window of time by which the package is expected to be delivered.

availableNotifications.description:
The types of email notifications that are available for the package.
Example:ON_DELIVERY

shipperInformation.description: Contact and address information of shipper.

lastUpdatedDestinationAddress.description: Last updated delivery address for the package.

TrackResult.description: Contains detailed tracking information for the requested packages(s). In case of duplicates, multiple track details will be populated.

hasAssociatedShipments.description:
Field which indicates if the current shipment has associated shipments.
Example: false

nickname.description:
Field which holds information about nickname of the shipment.
Example: Shipment nickname

packageIdentifiers.description: Other related identifiers for this package such as reference numbers, purchase order number etc. Provides identifiers other than tracking number that can be used in order to track the shipment.

shipmentNotes.description:
Field which holds customer assigned notes for a package.
Example: shipment notes

AdditionalTrackingInfo.description: Additional Tracking number information like nickname, notes, shipment attributes etc.

type.description:
Indicate the package identifier to identify the package.
Example: SHIPPER_REFERENCE

value.description:
Field which holds the value of the identifier used to identify the package.
Example: 'ASJFGVAS'

trackingNumberUniqueId.description:
Unique identifier used to distinguish duplicate FedEx tracking numbers. This value will be set by FedEx systems.
Example: 245822\~123456789012\~FDEG

PackageIdentifier.description: The type and value of the package identifier that is to be used to retrieve the tracking information for a package or group of packages.

units.description: Field which holds the distance unit type.

value.description:
Field which holds the value for the distance.
Example: 685.78

Distance.description: Distance remaining to the destination. Only returned for FedEx Custom Critical shipments.

timeStamp.description:
The timestamp for the consolidation.
Example: 2020-10-13T03:54:44-06:00

consolidationID.description:
The identifier for the consolidation.
Example: 47936927

reasonDetail.description: Specifies the reason details for the consolidation event for a package.

packageCount.description:
Specifies the package count for the consolidation.
Example: 25

eventType.description:
Specifies the consolidation event type for a package. A package can be ADDED to, REMOVED from, or EXCLUDED from a consolidation.
Example: PACKAGE_ADDED_TO_CONSOLIDATION

ConsolidationDetail.description: This is the consolidation details for packages within a shipment identified as CONSOLIDATED.

description.description:
Field which holds the reason description.
Example: Wrong color

type.description:
Field which holds the reason type.
Example: REJECTED

ReasonDetail.description: This object contains reason description and type.

authorizationName.description: Name of person authorizing the return, entered by the customer.

ReturnDetail.description: Specifies return information related to a return shipment.

description.description:
Field which holds the text description of the service type of this package.
Example: FedEx Freight Economy

shortDescription.description:
Field which holds the abbreviated text description of the service type of this package.
Example: FL

type.description:
This is the service type.
Example: FEDEX_FREIGHT_ECONOMY
Click here to see Service Types

ServiceDescriptionDetail.description: This object contains service description details for the package.

scanLocation.description: Address information related to the associated Status.

code.description:
A code that identifies this type of status.
Example:PU,DE,DP,HL,OC

derivedCode.description:
Specifies the latest status detail code of the package.
Example:PU,DE,DP,HL,OC

ancillaryDetails.description: Specifies the cause of exception along with any action that needs to taken by customer.

statusByLocale.description:
This is the latest tracking status by locale.
Example: Picked up

description.description:
A human-readable description of this status.
Example: Picked up

StatusDetail.description: Specifies details about the status of the track information for the shipment being tracked.  AncilliaryDetails may also be available which describe the cause of exception along with any action that needs to taken by customer.

reason.description:
Field which holds Reason code associated to the status of the shipment being tracked.
Example: 15,84,IN001,015A,02

reasonDescription.description:
Field which holds Reason description associated to the status of the shipment being tracked.
Example: Customer not available or business closed,Local delivery restriction, delivery not attempted,Package delivered to recipient address - release authorized
reasonDescription.example: Customer not available or business closed

action.description:
Field which holds recommended action for customer to resolve reason.
Example: Contact us at to discuss possible delivery or pickup alternatives.
action.example: Contact us at <http://www.fedex.com/us/customersupport/call/index.html> to discuss possible delivery or pickup alternatives.

actionDescription.description:
Field which holds recommended action description for customer to resolve reason.
Example: Customer not Available or Business Closed
actionDescription.example: Customer not Available or Business Closed

StatusAncillaryDetail.description: Field which holds status code of the track information for the shipment being tracked.

status.description: Specifies the status of package indicating whether a package is arriving early or is on time or has been delayed.

message.description:
Field which holds the commitment message for this package.
Example: No scheduled delivery date available at this time.
message.example: No scheduled delivery date available at this time.

type.description:
Field which holds the type of service commit message.
Example: ESTIMATED_DELIVERY_DATE_UNAVAILABLE

ServiceCommitMessage.description: Commitment message for this package. Informative messages related to the package. Used to convey information such as FedEx has received information about a package but has not yet taken possession of it. FedEx has handed the package off to a third party for final delivery. The package delivery has been cancelled.

code.description:
Field which holds the code that designates the type of informational message being returned.
Example: 'CLEARANCE_ENTRY_FEE_APPLIES'

description.description:
Field which holds the The informational message in human readable form.
Example: this is an informational message

InformationNoteDetail.description: Notifications to the end user that provide additional information relevant to the tracked shipment. For example, a notification may indicate that a change in behavior has occurred.

value.description:
Identifies the error option to be applied.
Example: value

key.description:
Indicates the value associated with the key.
Example: key

Parameter.description: List of parameters which indicates the properties of the alert message.

description.description:
Field which holds the text description of the special handling code.
Example: Deliver Weekday

type.description:
Field which holds type representing the special handling.
Example: DELIVER_WEEKDAY

paymentType.description:
Field which holds information about the payment handling related to the special handling.
Example: OTHER

TrackSpecialHandling.description:
Specify types of special handlings that are applied to this package.
Click here to see FedEx Express Special Handling Codes.

size.description: Field which holds the size of available images for the shipment being tracked. Example: LARGE

type.description:
Field which holds the type of available images for the shipment being tracked.
Example: BILL_OF_LADING

AvailableImagesDetail.description: The available tracking documents for the shipment being tracked. Available tracking documents includes SPOD and Bill of lading.

receivedByName.description:
Field which holds the name of the person who received the package, if applicable.
Example: Receiver

destinationServiceArea.description:
Field which holds the destination service area code.
Example: EDDUNAVAILABLE

destinationServiceAreaDescription.description:
Field which holds the description corresponding to the destination service area.
Example: Appointment Required

locationDescription.description:
Field which holds the FedEx location description for the package destination.
Example: Receptionist/Front Desk

deliveryToday.description:
This element indicates whether the package will be delivered today. The value 'True', indicates that today is package delivery.
Example: true

locationType.description: Field which holds the FedEx location type code for the package destination. If  Location Type not available we will get empty value.

signedByName.description:
Field which holds the name of the person who signed for the package, if applicable.
Example: Reciever

officeOrderDeliveryMethod.description:
Field which identifies the method of office order delivery. 'Pickup' - the recipient will be picking up the office order from the FedEx Office Center. 'Shipment' - the office order will be delivered to the recipient as a FedEx shipment using the FedEx Service Type requested. 'Courier' - the office order will be delivered to the recipient by local courier.
Example: Courier

deliveryAttempts.description:
Field which holds the number of delivery attempts made to deliver the package.
Example: 0

deliveryOptionEligibilityDetails.description: Specifies eligibility type for the different delivery option.

DeliveryDetails.description: Delivery related information for the tracked package. Provides delivery details as actual delivery address once the package is delivered, the number of delivery attempts made etc.

option.description:
This is the type of delivery option.

Note: For eligibile DISPUTE_DELIVERY, RETURN_TO_SHIPPER, SUPPLEMENT_ADDRESS go to fedex.com to perform the option/action.

Example: INDIRECT_SIGNATURE_RELEASE

eligibility.description:
Eligibility of the customer for the specific delivery options.
Example: INELIGIBLE

DeliveryOptionElgibilityDetails.description: Specifies details of delivery options and its eligibility type

date.description:
Date and time of the scan event.
Example: '2018-02-02T12:01:00-07:00'

derivedStatus.description:
Field which holds status description of the track information for the scan event.
Example: 'Picked Up'

scanLocation.description: Location Details for the FedEx facility where the scan event occurred.

locationId.description:
Location Identification for facilities identified by an alpha numeric location code. Passing Location Id of the Hold at Location (HAL) address is strongly recommended to ensure packages are delivered to the correct address.
Example: SEA

locationType.description: This field holds Location Type. If  Location Type not available we will get empty value

exceptionDescription.description:
Field which holds the text description for the exception if the event was an exception .
Example: Package available for clearance

eventDescription.description:
Field which holds the text description of the scan event.
Example: 'Picked Up'

eventType.description:
Field which holds the code identifying the type of scan event.
Example: 'PU'

derivedStatusCode.description:
Field which holds status code of the track information for the scan event.
Example: 'PU'

exceptionCode.description:
Field which holds the code identifier for the exception if the event was an exception.
Example: A25

ScanEvent.description:
FedEx scanning event information for a package.
Click here to see Track Service Scan Codes.

dateTime.description:
Field which holds the tracking date or timestamp in ISO format.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: '2019-05-07'

type.description:
Field which holds information about the type of tracking date or timestamp.
Example: 'ACTUAL_DELIVERY'

TrackingDateAndTime.description: Date and time information for the tracked shipment. Date and time information for the tracked shipment includes various type of date time including when the package was shipped, when it is expected to deliver, when it is actually delivered etc.

physicalPackagingType.description:
Indicate the physical package type for non-Express shipments.
Click here to see Available Types

sequenceNumber.description:
Field which holds the number representing which package in a multi-piece shipment applies to this TrackDetail.
Example: 45

undeliveredCount.description:
Field which holds information about total count of the undelivered packages in the shipment.
Example: 7

count.description:
Field which holds the total number of pieces in the shipment which includes the package represented by this TrackDetail.
Example: 1

packageContent.description:
Field which holds information about the package content of the shipment. Populated for secure users only.
Example: wire hangers.

contentPieceCount.description:
Field which holds information about total count of the packages in the shipment.
Example: 100

declaredValue.description: This is the declared value. Declared Value represents FedEx maximum liability in connection with a shipment of that Package, including but not limited to, any loss, damage, delay, misdelivery, any failure to provide information, or misdelivery of information relating to the Shipment.

PackageDetail.description: Details of the packages in the shipment being tracked. Includes details like package type, weight, dimensions, declared value, etc.

description.description:
Indicate the packaging type description.
Example: FedEx Pak

type.description:
Indicate the packaging type.
Click here to see Package Types

PackagingDescription.description: Description of the packaging used for this shipment.

weight.description: Field which holds the weight of the package.

dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

TrackingWeightAndDimensions.description: Field which holds the weight and dimension information.

value.description:
This is package weight. Max. Length is 99999.
Example: 22222.0

Weight.description: These are the package weight details.

length.description:
Indicate the length of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 20

width.description:
Indicate the width of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

height.description:
Indicate the height of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

units.description:
Unit of measure for the provided dimensions.
Valid Values are IN - inches, CM - centimeters.
Note: Any value other than CM including blank/null will default to IN.
Example: CM

Dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

currency.description:
Indicate the currency code.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency Codes

value.description:
Field which holds the amount value.
Example: 56.80

description.description:
Field which specifies the description of the custom delivery option requested
Example: Redirect the package to the hold location.
description.example: Redirect the package to the hold location.

type.description:
Field which specifies the type of the custom delivery option requested.
Example: REDIRECT_TO_HOLD_AT_LOCATION

status.description:
Field which specifies the status of the custom delivery option requested.
Example: HELD

CustomDeliveryOption.description: List of delivery options that can be used to customize the delivery of the package.

date.description:
Field which holds the requested appointment date.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
example: '2019-05-07'

window.description: Array of different appointment time windows available on the date specified such as, Morning, afternoon, mid-day.

RequestedAppointmentDetail.description: Field which specifies the details of the requested appointment.

description.description:
Field which describes the time window provided.
Example: Description field

type.description:
Field which holds the code representing the description for the time window provided.
Example: ESTIMATED_DELIVERY

begins.description:
Field which holds the begin date/timestamp for a range.
Example: '2021-10-01T08:00:00'

ends.description:
Field which holds the end date/timestamp for a range.
Example: '2021-10-15T00:00:00-06:00'

TimeRange.description: Field which holds a date/timestamp window.

count.description:
Field which holds the piece count.
Example: 35

description.description:
Field which holds the piece count description detail.
Example: picec count description

type.description:
Field which holds the piece count location type.
Example: ORIGIN

PieceCountDetail.description: Specifies the count of the packages delivered and the count of the packages at the origin which can be used for verification purposes. Populated for secure users only.

contents.description: Field which holds information about contents of the shipment. Populated for secure users only.

beforePossessionStatus.description:
Indicates the shipment is not yet in FedEx possession, but is still in shipper's possession.
Example: false

weight.description: Array of package level weights, which represent the total weight of the shipment.

contentPieceCount.description:
Field which holds information about content piece count of the shipment.
Example: 3333

splitShipments.description: Field which holds information about split shipments.

TrackShipmentDetail.description: Shipment level details for the shipment being tracked. Includes overall shipment weight, contents etc.

itemNumber.description:
Field holds the item number for the contents of shipment.
Example: RZ5678

receivedQuantity.description:
Field which holds information about the quantity received.
Example: 13

description.description:
Field which holds informative description about shipment content.
Example: pulyurethane rope

partNumber.description:
Holds the part number of the content in shipment.
Example: RK1345

ShipmentContent.description: Field which holds information about contents of the shipment. Populated for secure users only.

pieceCount.description:
Field which holds the number of pieces in the part.
Example: 10

statusDescription.description:
Field which holds human-readable description of the status.
Example: status

timestamp.description:
Field which holds the date and time the status began.
Example: '2019-05-07T08:00:07'

statusCode.description:
Field which holds the status code.
Example: statusCode

TrackSplitShipment.description: Holds the information about split shipments.

senderContactName.description:
Placeholder for Sender contact name.
Example: Sam Smith

senderEMailAddress.description:
Email address of the sender from which the shipment notification will be sent.
Example: LSR123@gmail.com

shipDateBegin.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number in a specific time range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
example:'2019-10-13'

shipDateEnd.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number in a specific time range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
example:'2019-10-13'

Full_Schema_Notification.description: The request to receive a tracking notification.

role.description:
This is to specify Recipient_Role in the shipment.
Possible values - BROKER, OTHER, RECIPIENT, SHIPPER
Example: SHIPPER

notificationEventTypes.description:
Identifies the events for which the client is requesting notifications.
Possible Values are: ON_DELIVERY, ON_ESTIMATED_DELIVERY, ON_EXCEPTION, ON_TENDER

currentResultRequestedFlag.description:
If value is 'true' the current tracking results for the shipment along with notification details will be provided to the client. If 'false' only results for the notification request is provided.
Defaults to 'false'
Example: true

TrackingNotification.description: Identifies a list of details for Tracking Notifications

notificationType.description:
Identifies the format of the notification.
valid values are 'HTML' or 'TEXT'.

TrackingNotificationDetail.description: Information about the notification email and the language of the notification requested.

languageCode.description:
Identifies two-letter code for the language (e.g. en/EN, fr/FR, es/ES etc..).
Example: en

localeCode.description:
Identifies the two-letter code for the region, used to further identify the requested language. for example, if you request Spanish, you must include a locale code of US for North American Spanish, or MX for Mexico.
Example: US
Click here to see Locales

Localization.description: Specifies the language details for email notification.

emailAddress.description:
Specifies email address on which user wants to get notified for various registered events.
Example: p1@fedex.com

name.description:
Specifies the name of the notification recipient.
Example: Sam Smith

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

TrkcResponseVO_Notifications.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

TrackingNumberInfo.description: Tracking number information which uniquely identifies a package. Tracking number information includes tracking number, carrier code and a unique qualifier.

destinationAddress.description: Address where the package was actually delivered. Contrast with destination Address, which is the location to which the package was intended to be delivered. Addresses may differ due to delivery to a neighbor, hold at FedEx location, etc.

recipientDetails.description: Details of the recipient notification events. Possible events are - ON_DELIVERY, ON_ESTIMATED_DELIVERY, ON_EXCEPTION, ON_TENDER.

alerts.description:
The cxs shipment alerts. This includes the alert type, code, and message.
example: TRACKING.DATA.NOTFOUND - Tracking data unavailable

notificationEventTypes.description:
Identifies the events for which the client is requesting notifications. Possible events are - ON_DELIVERY, ON_ESTIMATED_DELIVERY, ON_EXCEPTION, ON_TENDER
Example: [ON_DELIVERY,ON_ESTIMATED_DELIVERY,ON_EXCEPTION]

includeDetailedScans.description:
Indicates if the detailed scans are being requested or not. If true, the detailed scans will be included in the response returned.
Valid values are True or False.

Full_Schema_Tracking_References.description:
Specifies the request elements for Track by alternate reference.
For a valid request there are two combinations:
1.) A referenceValue and accountNumber is required OR
2.) referenceType & carrierCode, shipdateBegin and shipDateEnd, destinationPostalCode and destinationCountryCode are required.

carrierCode.description:
Specifies which carrier should be included.
Example: FDXE

type.description:
Specify the type of alternate reference used. This is Conditionally required.
Valid Values :
  • BILL_OF_LADING
  • COD_RETURN_TRACKING_NUMBER
  • CUSTOMER_AUTHORIZATION_NUMBER
  • CUSTOMER_REFERENCE
  • DEPARTMENT
  • DOCUMENT_AIRWAY_BILL
  • EXPRESS_ALTERNATE_REFERENCE
  • FEDEX_OFFICE_JOB_ORDER_NUMBER
  • FREE_FORM_REFERENCE
  • GROUND_INTERNATIONAL
  • GROUND_SHIPMENT_ID
  • INTERNATIONAL_DISTRIBUTION
  • INVOICE
  • JOB_GLOBAL_TRACKING_NUMBER
  • ORDER_GLOBAL_TRACKING_NUMBER
  • ORDER_TO_PAY_NUMBER
  • PART_NUMBER
  • PARTNER_CARRIER_NUMBER
  • PURCHASE_ORDER
  • REROUTE_TRACKING_NUMBER
  • RETURN_MATERIALS_AUTHORIZATION
  • RETURNED_TO_SHIPPER_TRACKING_NUMBER
  • SHIPPER_REFERENCE
  • TRANSBORDER_DISTRIBUTION
  • TRANSPORTATION_CONTROL_NUMBER
  • VIRTUAL_CONSOLIDATION

value.description:
Conditionally required.
Specifies the alternate reference value.
Example: 56754674567546754

accountNumber.description:
Conditionally required.
Specifies the shipper's account number.
Note: Either account number or destination postal code and country code are mandatory to track by reference.
Example: 697561862

shipDateBegin.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number within a specific date range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: 2020-03-29

shipDateEndDate.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number within a specific date range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: 2020-04-01

destinationCountryCode.description:
Conditionally required.
Specifies the recipient's country code.
Note: Either account number or destination postal code and country code are mandatory to track by reference.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

destinationPostalCode.description:
Conditionally required.
Indicate recipient postal code. Required for postal-aware countries.
Note: Either account number or destination postal code and country code are mandatory to track by reference.
Example: 75063
Click here to see Postal aware countries

ReferenceInformation.description:
Specifies the reference details for the tracked shipment. The following rules apply
- Either shipper.AccountNumber or Destination.countryCode(and postal for postal aware countries) are required
- If ShipDateRangeBegin and End are not present, shipDateRangeBegin will be set to the current date minus 30 days, and shipDdateRangeEnd will default to current date plus one day.

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

TrkcResponseVO_ReferenceNumber.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

cxsErrors.description: Indicates error alert when suspicious files, potential exploits and viruses found while scanning files , directories and user accounts. This includes code, message and parameter.

completeTrackResults.description:
Contains detailed tracking entry information.
Valid values: ACTUAL_DELIVERY, ACTUAL_PICKKUP, ACTUAL_TENDER, ANTICIPATED_TENDER, APPOINTMENT_DELIVERY, ATTEMPTED_DELIVERY, COMMITMENT, ESTIMATED_ARRIVAL_AT_GATEWAY, ESTIMATED_DELIVERY, ESTIMATED_PICKUP, ESTIMATED_RETURN_TO_STATION, SHIP, SHIPMENT_DATE_RECEIVED

alerts.description:
The cxs alert type, alert code, and alert message that is received.
example: TRACKING.DATA.NOTFOUND - Tracking data unavailable

successful.description: Indicates whether the tracking is successful.

TrackingReferencesResponse.description: Specifies the response elements for Track by alternate reference request.

tcnInfo.description:
The information associated with the transportation control number.
Only 1 TCN is supported per request.

includeDetailedScans.description:
Indicates if detailed scans are requested or not.
Valid values are True, or False.

Full_Schema_TCN.description: The request elements for Tracking by TCN request type.

value.description:
Field which holds the Transportation Control Number value.
Example: N552428361Y555XXX

carrierCode.description:
Field which holds information about carrier code of the shipment.
Example: FDXE

shipDateBegin.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number within a specific date range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: 2020-03-29

shipDateEnd.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number within a specific date range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: 2020-04-01

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

TrkcResponseVO_TCN.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

alerts.description:
alert type, alert code, and alert message
Example: TRACKING.DATA.NOTFOUND - Tracking data unavailable

TrackingNumbersResponse_TCN.description: The response elements for the Track by TCN request.

trackDocumentDetail.description: This object specifies the tracking document details such as types of documents, for example, SIGNATURE_PROOF_OF_DELIVERY and also the format of tracking document. Supported values are PDF and PNG. Default is PDF.

trackDocumentSpecification.description:
This is the placeholder for document specification details required to identify the shipment being tracked. This includes tracking information such as tracking qualifier, carrier code, and tracking number.
At least one trackDocumentSpecification is required. Maximum limit is 30.

documentType.description:
Indicate the Tracking Document.
Valid values are SIGNATURE_PROOF_OF_DELIVERY, BILL_OF_LADING and FREIGHT_BILLING_DOCUMENT.
Example: SIGNATURE_PROOF_OF_DELIVERY.
Note: The SPOD information will be presented as a byte array instead of an image. The byte array is a base64 encoded string, which should be decoded to get the final signature image in PDF or PNG format

documentFormat.description:
Specifies the format of tracking document.
Valid values are PDF or PNG.
The values are key sensitive.
Note: documentTypes BILL_OF_LADING and FREIGHT_BILLING_DOCUMENT does not support PNG.

shipDateBegin.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are used to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number during a specific date range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
example: '2020-03-29'

shipDateEnd.description:
ShipDateBegin and ShipDateEnd are recommended to narrow the search, reduce lookup time, and avoid duplicates when searching for a specific tracking number during a specific date range.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
example: '2020-04-01'

accountNumber.description:
Specifies Signature Proof of Delivery(SPOD) account number for the shipment being tracked.
Conditionally required when documentType is BILL_OF_LADING or FREIGHT_BILLING_DOCUMENT
Example: 123456789

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

TrkcResponseVO_SPOD.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

documentType.description:
The types of tracking document.
Example: SIGNATURE_PROOF_OF_DELIVERY

documentFormat.description:
The format of the tracking document.
Valid values are PDF and PNG.

document.description:
This field holds the list of byte array(base64) which specifies the image of the recipient's signature (if the signature is available) once the shipment has been delivered.
Example: []

alerts.description:
Specifies the alert received when the recipient's signature has been taken as a proof of shipment delivery.
Example: TRACKING.DATA.NOTFOUND - Tracking data unavailable

includeDetailedScans.description:
Indicates if detailed scans are requested or not.
Valid values are True, or False.

trackingInfo.description: The tracking information of the shipment to be tracked. At least one occurrence of TrackingInfo is required. Maximum limit is 30.

Full_Schema_Tracking_Numbers.description: The request elements for Tracking by Tracking Number.

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

TrkcResponseVO_TrackingNumber.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

completeTrackResults.description:
Contains detailed tracking entry information.
Valid values are- ACTUAL_DELIVERY, ACTUAL_PICKUP, ACTUAL_TENDER, ANTICIPATED_TENDER, APPOINTMENT_DELIVERY, ATTEMPTED_DELIVERY, COMMITMENT, ESTIMATED_ARRIVAL_AT_GATEWAY, ESTIMATED_DELIVERY, ESTIMATED_PICKUP, ESTIMATED_RETURN_TO_STATION, SHIP, SHIPMENT_DATA_RECEIVED.

alerts.description:
The cxs alert type, alert code and alert message
Example: TRACKING.DATA.NOTFOUND - Tracking data unavailable

TrackingNumbersResponse.description: The response elements for Tracking by tracking number request

locationId.description:
Location Identification for facilities identified by an alpha numeric location code. Passing Location Id of the Hold at Location (HAL) address is strongly recommended to ensure packages are delivered to the correct address.
Example: SEA

LocationDetail_origin.description: Location details for the fedex facility.

trackingNumber.description:
This is a Tracking number for FedEx packages used for tracking a single package or group of packages.
Example: 128667043726
Click here to see Mock Tracking Numbers.

carrierCode.description:
This is a placeholder to provide the FedEx operating company (transportation) code used for package delivery.
Example: FDXE

trackingNumberUniqueId.description:
Unique identifier used to distinguish duplicate FedEx tracking numbers. This value will be set by FedEx systems.
Example: 245822\~123456789012\~FDEG

TrackingNumberInfo.description: Information uniquely identifying a shipment such as Tracking number, ShipDate, and Tracking number uniqueId.

resultsPerPage.description:
Use this element to specify the number of Tracking results to be returned in the Tracking response. Use this and pagingToken elements, to retrieve remaining set of the track results.

Here is how the paging works:
For your first track request, send element resultsPerPage, with a number XX (5) and the response will return XX (5) results along with element pagingToken and moreDataAvailable = true or false based on the number of tracking results.

  • If moreDataAvailable = false, then there are no more track results can be retrieved further.
  • If moreDataAvailable = True, then it means there are more track results and hence send the next tracking request with resultsPerPage = YY (4) and pagingToken = XX + 1 (5) from Track Response element pagingToken. This can be continued until the moreDataAvailable becomes false or there are no more tracking results.

Example: 10

pagingToken.description:
Use this element to specify the starting sequence for the next set of tracking results. This element can be specified if paging is used in the initial tracking request and you need to request next set of track results.

Note: This element not to be used in the initial tracking request and only should be used in the subsequent track requests when there is paging (element resultsPerPage is specified) indicated.


Example: 1234567890

PagingDetails.description: Specify the details about how to retrieve the subsequent pages when there is more than one page in the TrackReply.

classification.description:
Specifies the FedEx classification type for an address.
Valid values are BUSINESS, RESIDENTIAL, MIXED, UNKNOWN.
Example: BUSINESS

residential.description: Placeholder to indicate whether the address is residential (as opposed to commercial).

streetLines.description:
Combination of number, street name, etc. At least one line is required for a valid physical address; empty lines should not be included.
Example: ["1043 North Easy Street", "Suite 999"]

city.description:
Conditional
The name of the city, town, etc.
Example: SEATTLE

urbanizationCode.description:
Relevant only to addresses in Puerto Rico, where multiple addresses within the same postal code can have the same house number and street name. When this is the case, the urbanization code is needed to distinguish them.
Example: RAFAEL

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
This is a placeholder for State or Province code.
Example: CA
Click here to see State/Province Code

postalCode.description:
Placeholder to specify postal code for the address. Postal Code is required for postal-aware countries.
Example: 98101
Click here to see Postal aware countries

countryCode.description:
Placeholder for country code (2 characters) for the address.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

countryName.description:
Field holds the fully spelled out name of a country.
Example: United States

AddressVO.description: Address where the package was actually delivered. Contrast with destinationAddress, which is the location to which the package was intended to be delivered. Addresses may differ due to delivery to a behavior, hold at FedEx location, etc.

addressClassification.description:
Specifies the FedEx classification type for an address.
Valid values are BUSINESS, RESIDENTIAL, MIXED, UNKNOWN.
Example: BUSINESS

residential.description: Placeholder to indicate whether the address is residential (as opposed to commercial).

streetLines.description:
Combination of number, street name, etc. At least one line is required for a valid physical address; empty lines should not be included.
Example: ["1043 North Easy Street", "Suite 999"].
Note: Street lines is shown in response only in secured flow. For non secured flow, street lines is not shown in the response.

city.description:
Conditional
The name of the city, town, etc.
Example: SEATTLE

urbanizationCode.description:
Relevant only to addresses in Puerto Rico, where multiple addresses within the same postal code can have the same house number and street name. When this is the case, the urbanization code is needed to distinguish them.
Example: RAFAEL

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
This is a placeholder for State or Province code.
Example: CA
Click here to see State/Province Code

postalCode.description:
Placeholder to specify postal code for the address. Postal Code is required for postal-aware countries.
Example: 98101
Click here to see Postal aware countries

countryCode.description:
Placeholder for country code (2 characters) for the address.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

countryName.description:
Field holds the fully spelled out name of a country.
Example: United States

AddressVO_2.description: Address where the package was actually delivered. Contrast with destinationAddress, which is the location to which the package was intended to be delivered. Addresses may differ due to delivery to a behavior, hold at FedEx location, etc.

message.description:
Indicates the description of API error alert message.
Example: The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

CXSError.description: Indicates error alert when suspicious files, potential exploits and viruses found while scanning files , directories and user accounts. This includes code, message and parameter

locationId.description:
Location Identification for facilities identified by an alpha numeric location code. Passing Location Id of the Hold at Location (HAL) address is strongly recommended to ensure packages are delivered to the correct address.
Example: SEA

locationType.description: This field holds FedEx Location Type. If  Location Type not available we will get empty value.

LocationDetail.description: Location details for the fedex facility.

address.description:
Required.

Descriptive data for a physical location.  may be used as an actual physical address(place to which one could go), or a container of 'address parts' which should be handled as a unit(such as a city-state-zip combination within the US).

Conditional when used with Payor object.  Required if entering using RECIPIENT or THIRD_PARTY.  Required if not-authenticated and SENDER is selected

personName.description:
Identifies the contact person's name. Max Length is 70.
Example: John Taylor

phoneNumber.description:
Identifies the phone number associated with this contact. Max length is 15.
Example: '1234567890'

companyName.description:
Identifies the company this contact is associated with. Max length is 35.
Example: Fedex

ContactVO.description:
Indicate the contact details for this package.
Note: contact is shown in response only in secured flow. For non secured flow, contact is not shown in the response.'

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

trackingNotifications.description: List of Tracking notifications requested for events like ON_DELIVERY, ON_ESTIMATED_DELIVERY, ON_EXCEPTION, ON_TENDER.

personalMessage.description: An optional message which will be included in the body of the email.

supportHTML.title: @Ignore4TPP
supportHTML.description: If value is 'true' then html tags are included in the response date.  If 'false' they are not provided in the response.
